question: A block weighing W = 5.0 N drops inside a cylinder from a height h = 200 mm onto a spring having stiffness k = 90 N/m. Determine the maximum shortening of the spring due to the impact.<image 1>
description: The image depicts a mechanical setup involving a block, a cylinder, and a spring. The block is shown at the top of the cylinder, and it is about to drop into the cylinder from a certain height \( h \). The cylinder is filled with a fluid, which is likely water, given its blue color. At the bottom of the cylinder, there is a spring labeled with the variable \( k \), indicating its stiffness. The height \( h \) from which the block will drop is also indicated in the diagram. The block is shown with an arrow pointing downward, suggesting its impending motion due to gravity. The spring is coiled and appears to be compressed when the block impacts it.
